start_feature.usage: Used to launch complete feature development process, automatically generate requirement documents, design plans, and effort estimates

params.name: template_profile
params.desc: Template profile: auto, guided, or strict

start_bugfix.description: Bug fix workflow orchestration: check context â†’ analyze location â†’ fix plan â†’ generate tests
start_bugfix.usage: Used to systematically fix bugs, providing complete analysis, location, fix, and test plans

params.name: template_profile
params.desc: Template profile: auto, guided, or strict

start_bugfix.example:
// Example

start_onboard.description: Project onboarding workflow: generate context documentation, help new members quickly understand the project
start_onboard.usage: Help new members quickly understand project structure, tech stack, and development standards
start_onboard.example:
// Example

start_ralph.description: Ralph Wiggum Loop automated development, start iterative development process with multiple safety protections enabled by default
start_ralph.usage: Start automated iterative development, AI will continuously iterate until goal is achieved or safety limits are reached

params.name: mode
params.desc: Run mode: safe (safe mode, default), normal (normal mode)

params.name: max_minutes
params.desc: Max runtime minutes, safe mode default 25

start_ralph.example:
// Example
You: Please use start_ralph tool to implement user authentication feature

goal: "Implement user authentication feature"
mode: "safe"

start_product.usage: One-click complete full process from requirements to HTML prototype, generate product prototype ready for demonstration

params.name: description
params.desc: Product description, detailed description of product goals, features, and user needs

params.name: product_type
params.desc: Product type, like SaaS, E-commerce, etc.

start_product.example:

start_ui.usage: One-click complete UI development full process, from design system to final code

params.name: framework
params.desc: Target framework: react, vue, html, default react

params.name: template
params.desc: Template name, auto-generate if not provided

params.name: template_profile
params.desc: Template profile: auto, guided, or strict

start_ui.example:
// Example

description: "Login page"

code_review.description: Intelligent code review, analyze code from multiple dimensions: security, performance, quality, style, and best practices
code_review.usage: Comprehensively review code quality, output structured issue list (severity/category/suggestion)

params.name: code
params.desc: Code to review, can be code snippet, complete file, or git diff output

params.name: focus
params.desc: Review focus: security, performance, quality, all, default all

fix_bug.description: Bug fix guidance, provide root cause analysis, fix plan, test plan, and preventive measures
fix_bug.usage: Provide complete bug fix guidance, including root cause analysis, fix plan, test plan, and preventive measures
fix_bug.example:
// Example
You: Please use fix_bug tool to fix this issue

error_message: "Database connection timeout"
code_context: "await db.connect({ timeout: 1000 })"

refactor.description: Refactoring suggestion tool, analyze code structure, provide refactoring steps, risk assessment, and rollback plan
refactor.usage: Analyze code structure, provide refactoring suggestions, refactoring steps, and risk assessment

gencommit.description: Automatically generate Git commit messages following Conventional Commits specification based on code changes
gencommit.usage: Generate commit messages following Conventional Commits specification based on code changes

params.name: changes
params.desc: Code changes content, can be git diff output, change description, or natural language

params.name: type
params.desc: Commit type: feat, fix, docs, style, chore, refactor, test, auto-detected

git_work_report.description: Generate work report (daily/periodic) based on Git diff analysis, intelligently extract actual work content
git_work_report.usage: Automatically read Git commits for specified date, analyze diff content, generate concise professional Chinese work report. If direct command fails, will provide temporary script solution (auto-delete after execution)

params.name: date
params.desc: Single date, format YYYY-MM-DD (daily report mode)

params.name: start_date
params.desc: Start date, format YYYY-MM-DD (periodic report mode)

params.name: end_date
params.desc: End date, format YYYY-MM-DD (periodic report mode)

git_work_report.example:
// Example - Generate daily report
You: Please use git_work_report tool to generate daily report for 2026-02-03

date: "2026-02-03"

// Or generate periodic report
You: Please use git_work_report tool to generate weekly report from 2026-02-01 to 2026-02-07

start_date: "2026-02-01"
end_date: "2026-02-07"

gentest.description: Generate unit tests, support Jest/Vitest/Mocha frameworks, include edge cases and mock data
gentest.usage: Generate unit test code, including edge cases and mocks

params.name: code
params.desc: Code to generate tests for, can be function, class, or module

params.name: framework
params.desc: Test framework: jest, vitest, mocha, auto-detect project framework

gentest.example:
// Example
You: Please use gentest tool to generate tests

code: "function add(a, b) { return a + b; }"
framework: "jest"

init_project.description: Generate requirement/design/task documents following Spec-Driven Development approach
init_project.usage: Generate requirement/design/task documents following Spec-Driven Development approach

params.name: input
params.desc: Project requirement description, can be brief description or detailed functional requirement document

init_project_context.example:

add_feature.usage: Generate new feature specification document (requirements/design/task list), based on project context

params.name: template_profile
params.desc: Template profile: auto, guided, or strict

add_feature.example:
// Example

description: "Add user authentication feature, support email login and third-party login"

estimate.description: Estimate development effort, output story points, time range (optimistic/normal/pessimistic), risk points
estimate.usage: Estimate development effort, output story points, time range (optimistic/normal/pessimistic), risk points

params.name: experience_level
params.desc: Experience level: junior, mid, senior, default mid

estimate.example:
// Example
You: Please use estimate tool to estimate effort

interview.description: Requirement interview tool, clarify requirements through structured questions to avoid misunderstandings and rework
interview.usage: Requirement interview tool, clarify requirements through structured questions before development

ask_user.description: AI active question tool, support single or multiple questions, provide options, mark importance
ask_user.usage: AI actively asks user questions, support single or multiple questions, provide options, mark importance
ask_user.example:
// Example

ui_design_system.description: Intelligent design system generator, generate complete design specification based on product type reasoning
ui_design_system.usage: Based on product type and requirements, use AI reasoning engine to generate complete design system recommendations

params.name: description
params.desc: System description, detailed description of product features, characteristics, usage scenarios

params.name: stack
params.desc: Tech stack: react, vue, nextjs, etc.
